name: cfdump
description: Outputs the contents of a variable of any type for debugging purposes. The variable can be as simple as a string or as complex as a cfc component instance.

params.name: var
params.description:
Variable to display. Enclose a variable name in pound
 signs.

params.name: expand
params.description: Yes: In Internet Explorer and Mozilla, expands views

params.name: label
params.description: A string; header for the dump output.

params.name: top
params.description: CF7+ The number of rows to display. For a structure, this is the number of nested levels to display (useful for large stuctures).

params.name: format
params.description: CF8+ specify whether to save the results of a cfdump to a file in text or HTML format

params.name: keys
params.description: CF8+ For a structure, number of keys to display.

params.name: metainfo
params.description: CF8+ Includes information about the query in the cfdump results.

params.name: output
params.description: CF8+ Where to send the results of cfdump.

params.name: showUDfs
params.description: CF8+ show UDFs in cfdump output.

params.name: abort
params.description: CF9+ stops further processing of page

examples.title: Dump Server Scope (Tag Based)
examples.description: Outputs a listing of all the variables in the server scope.

examples.title: Dump Server Scope (Script Based)
examples.description: Outputs a listing of all the variables in the server scope.

examples.title: Dump Then Abort
